item.title: Pass by value and Pass by reference in Go
item.description: In Go, everything is passed by value. When we pass arguments to a function, a function always gets the copy of the data passed. For example, passing an int value to function makes a copy of the int, passing a pointer value makes a copy of the pointer but not the data it points to. When we pass a value to function it is called pass by value and when we pass a pointer to a function it is called pass by reference.
